Posts.Content: Sparkytheimp wrote: I just got diagnosed a few weeks ago. I see the surgeon on Wednesday and I have no idea what is in store for me. I have one friend that had a lumpectomy a few years ago and that is the most I know about anything. I read some of the threads in here and I notice there is one thing I absolutely don't know. What kind this is. I am hoping the surgeon will know? I am seeing a new oncologist for the first time on the same day. Oh, yay. I think if one more stranger touches my breast while I am awake I will scream. I have a lot of questions but the doctors so far have not been very helpful. Then again, maybe I just don't what questions to ask? I am seeing commonalities in you alls experiences and am thinking oh crap. Drain tubes? Can't lift my arms? I have trouble sleepng now as it is and now this? Sleepng comfortably shall be a challenge from what I am seeing. It's not all bad, don't get me wrong. I also see an incredible strength in here, and positive attitudes, and compassion and understanding, and I am glad for that. Any advice is greatly appreciated. Thank you. Surgery 6/21/2008 Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left Dx 5/7/2013, DCIS, 3cm, Stage IIIA, 1/17 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Well, this sucks Sparkytheimp cmharris59
